page.title: 09Grantham:Old Barracks
page.content: In Sandon Rd opposite the Kesteven and Grantham Girls' School there are some old barracks. Today the barracks are used mainly by the Grantham College of Further Education for teaching building and decorating skills.In 1985 Kesteven and Grantham Girls' School use several rooms for Computer Studies and the drill hall for Physical Education until their new buildings are completed in 1986.The old living quarters are owned by Lincolnshire County Council and are at present rented to employees of the Council. The barracks were built in the 1850s for the Royal South Lincolnshire Militia and the drill hall was used as a military hospital in the First World War.In 1985 the old rifle racks are still in position by the original guard room
